bibl.title: Sam Gum v. Henry M. White. Stipulation
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of SAM GUM, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus,

It is hereby stipulation by and between Beelr & Sullivan, attorneys for the Petitioner, and Robert C. Saunders, attorney for Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration of the United States Government, that one of the legal issues in the above entitled case has been heretofore decided by Honorable Jeremiah Neterer in the cases of the Petitioners Seid Yam and Chung Him, supporting the contention of the Petitioner in this case, and that the United States Government has appealed from the decision of Judge Neterer to the Circuit Court of Appeals, and the case is now pending and will be argued in the near future; that in fairness to all parties concerned, and to this Honorable Court, it is agreed that the hearing upon the merits of this Petition may be postponed until the decision in the appeal cases hereinabove mentioned, and upon the disposition of said cases by the Circuit Court of Appeals this Honorable Court may then set the herein case on the docket for hearing on the merits, and then make such decision as may to him then seem just and proper, for the Circuit Court will have then settled the law in and for this Circuit in one of the main issued in the case.

IS IT FURTHER STIPULATED AND AGREED that pending the final decision in this case, and until further order of the court, the said Petitioner, Sam Gum, may be released upon furnishing proper security in the sum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1000.00) approved by this Honorable Court.
Filed in the United States District Court
